availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary "Polly" N. Potts Jewell in Jessamine County, Kentucky, on September 3, 1825. Father of William L. Jewell, Felix E. Jewell, Sally A. Jewell, and Susan V. Jewell. Farmer in Daviess County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hickman County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daveiss County, District 1, p. 376A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Spring Hill, p. 563.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Hays, p. 203.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Spring Hill, p. 489A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jessamine County Marriages, Film 007724992.
